item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 3:35 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Middle-aged man trading cards go viral in rural Japan town (653 points | 114 comments)
2. Any program can be a GitHub Actions shell (48 points | 2 comments)
3. Show HN: Browser MCP – Automate your browser using Cursor, Claude, VS Code (363 points | 141 comments)

5. Deleting multiplayer from the Unreal engine can save memory (22 points | 5 comments)
6. Fuck Run Club, Join Sit Club (22 points | 5 comments)
7. What Was Quartz? (61 points | 28 comments)
8. Beyond Quacking: Deep Integration of Language Models and RAG into DuckDB (49 points | 9 comments)
9. Rising odds asteroid that briefly threatened Earth will hit moon (31 points | 29 comments)
10. 'Exploding' Tunnock's teacakes cleared by tests to fly again (5 points | discuss)
11. Scaffold Level Editor (72 points | 15 comments)
12. Fifty Years of Open Source Software Supply Chain Security (118 points | 57 comments)
13. A Supermarket Bag and a Truckload of FOMO (35 points | 7 comments)

15. An FPGA-based LGP-30 Replica (5 points | discuss)
16. Decoding the 90s: Cryptography in Early Software Development (2023) (104 points | 32 comments)

19. Show HN: Minimal MCP server in Go showcasing project architecture (32 points | 1 comment)
20. PiDP-1, or the rebirth of an old machine (74 points | 29 comments)
21. North Korean IT workers have infiltrated the Fortune 500 (29 points | 7 comments)
22. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (530 points | 420 comments)
23. The Troll Hole Adventure (32 points | 10 comments)
24. Glamorous Toolkit (302 points | 108 comments)
25. In the 1980s we also downloaded software from TV (30 points | 14 comments)
26. Why Companies Don't Fix Bugs (14 points | 1 comment)
27. Benchmarking LLM social skills with an elimination game (164 points | 51 comments)
28. A startup doesn't need to be a unicorn (522 points | 321 comments)
29. Deterministic simulation testing for async Rust (92 points | 8 comments)
30. We asked camera companies why their RAW formats are all different and confusing (334 points | 200 comments)
